page.title: 07BURGHFIELD-WILLINK SCHOOL
page.content: The Willink School was opened on 8th January 1957,taking 11-15 year olds who would have formerly gone to the original Blands School,now the site of an old people's home.Designed to meet the 1950s demand for new schools,the Willink began as a secondary-modern with 245 pupils and 11 teachers,headed by Mr N.Jackson.In 1957,the school had about 14 classrooms.The school motto was that of H.Willink-"Fides et Amor". In 1973 the school became a compre- hensive,and was extended.In 1985 the school has about 820 pupils,including a successful 6th form department.Sub- jects range from the traditional ( eg. maths,english etc.) to the modern, (computers,roadcraft,parentcraft etc.) The 48 teaching staff are now headed by Miss M.Hulbert,as Mr Jackson retired in 1982.The school catchment area extends to Tadley and Pangbourne.
